note.p:
Danger of electric shock! Contact with live components poses a risk of serious injury or even death!
Before starting work, switch off the electric power supply. Follow plant requirements for lockout tagout.

Life threatening hazard due to a falling vertical carriage!The unsecured vertical carriage can fall down and cause serious injury or even death!
Always make sure that the safety bolts of the vertical carriage are properly installed before carrying out work on / near the carriage
Danger of injury from improperly performed maintenance!Improper maintenance can result in serious personal injury or material damage!

ul.li: Before starting work, ensure that you have sufficient space!
Handle open, sharp-edged components with care!
Pay attention to cleanliness and orderliness at the place of work! Loose components and tools lying around are a potential cause of accidents!
Install all components correctly. Observe the prescribed bolt tightening torques! Secure the bolts with bolt locking com- pound (e.g. Weicon AN 302-43 (blue)) “medium strength”!
Secure components so that they cannot fall down or fall over!
Operating elements of the Emergency Stop system must be freely accessible!
Operate the machine only when all the safety devices, e.g. safety fence, light barriers and safety bolts are installed and fully functional!

note.p:
Risk of injury from stored pneumatic energy! Pneumatic energy may be stored in the machine that can lead to uncontrolled movements of components and injuries!
Follow plant requirements for lockout tagout of the system. Only then start the maintenance work!
Danger of crushing! There are several crushing points on the machine that can cause injuries!

ul.li: Do not reach between the following points:
the vertical carriage and the steel housing
the vertical carriage and the lifting mast
the locking pins and the container
the vertical carriage and the horizontal carriage!
No person is allowed inside the safety fence area when the machine is switched on!

note.p: Danger due to non-observance of the prohibition of transporting persons! The MSK transfer system can pose a serious risk in the event of non-compliance and/or circumvention of the prohibition of trans- porting persons.

ul.li: Only operate the transfer system when all safety devices are in place and in proper working condition, such as the programmed safety interlocks and physical E-Stops.
No persons are allowed on the transfer system!

note.p: Risk of injury due to stored hydraulic energy! Hydraulic energy can be stored in the machine and cause the un- controlled movement of components, which can lead to severe in- juries!

ul.li: Switch off the MSK system, as explained in this document.
Do not begin maintenance work until then!

note.p: Risk of injury due to laser radiation! Laser radiation can cause serious eye damage. Connie needs to follow-up with Steven and Kirk. We may need additional training.

ul.li: Do not look into the laser beam!
If it is not possible to avoid looking directly into the laser beam (e.g., during maintenance work), suitable eye protection must be worn.

note.p: Danger of electric shock ! Parts of the machine may still be live even when the emergency stop switch has been pressed!

ul.li: Do not touch live parts and leads!
Observe the instructions in the operating manual!
